src:
Manuel Cruz (PSC): "L'independentisme ha estat una fàbrica de simpatitzants de Vox"
Iceta considera que l'extrema dreta no hauria crescut tant sense l'"embolic" del Procés

06 Nov 2019, 10:26

Els socialistes s'ofereixen a la campanya del 10-N com l'única força capaç de vèncer l'extrema dreta i l'independentisme, un discurs que malgrat perseguir una imatge moderació topa amb l'enduriment del discurs a Catalunya. En les darreres hores, de fet, les cares visibles del PSC en aquestes eleccions han responsabilitzat l'independentisme del creixement de l'extrema dreta, una acusació que fins ara només havien llançat contra PP i Cs pels seu pactes amb Vox a les institucions.
En roda de premsa aquest dimecres a l'ACN, el president del Senat i candidat socialista a la cambra alta el 10-N, Manuel Cruz, ha admès que tant els populars com el partit taronja han "blanquejat"  i donat "vitamines polítiques" a la ultradreta dreta posant-la dins de governs autonòmics, però tot seguit ha afirmat que "l'independentisme ha estat una fàbrica de simpatitzants de Vox".
Preguntat per si estava responsabilitzant l'independentisme del creixement de la ultradreta, ha volgut matisar que certs "comportaments" de l'independentisme poden tenir aquest "efecte indesitjat" pel moviment, de la mateixa manera -ha dit- que hi pot haver "violència" en resposta a la sentència del Procés quan és "evident" que el "gruix" de l'independentisme és "pacific". "Si no, introduïm tabús en què no podem parlar de res", ha insistit.
Cruz no s'ha estat d'afegir que, en l'auge de la ultradreta, factors com el feminisme o la immigració també hi han tingut una implicació. Sobre la immigració, ha opinat que en el moment que Vox ho ha fet un "tema central" del seu discurs és "evident que hi ha una relació", mentre que sobre el feminisme no s'ha volgut mullar.
Mirant de reconduir un debat espinós, Cruz ha conclòs, amb tot, que l'augment de Vox o la previsible caiguda de representació de Cs haurien de fer "reflexionar" aquelles forces que el juliol van bloquejar la formació d'un govern socialista a l'Estat. "L'escenari no serà exactament el mateix, vull pensar que això farà reflexionar totes les forces", ha afirmat el president del Senat.




Sánchez s'erigeix com el candidat de la Catalunya "oblidada" pel Govern i assimila l'independentisme a la ultradreta

Aquest dimarts, però, el primer secretari del PSC, Miquel Iceta, ja va deixar anar en un acte a Sant Boi de Llobregat que Vox no pujaria tant en les enquestes sense l'"embolic" del Procés. "Algú creu que Vox hauria pujat tant sense l'embolic que s'ha muntat amb la independència a Catalunya? ¿Ho creiem de veritat? No", va afirmar.
Al seu parer "la dreta i l'independentisme es retroalimenten". "Es necessiten, es volen", va dir, argumentant que els independentistes es busquen que hi hagi "la pitjor Espanya" per així tenir arguments a favor de la secessió. Les paraules d'Iceta recullen el guant que en les últimes setmanes havia llançat Pedro Sánchez comparant l'extrema dreta amb el sobiranisme  perquè pensen que només hi ha "una Catalunya" i "una Espanya".
El "malentès" amb Sánchez: "Parlava com a representant de l'Estat"
Durant la roda de premsa d'aquest dimecres, Cruz no ha contradit Sánchez en aquest sentit, però sí que ha defensat que hi va haver un "malentès" amb el compromís de retornar Carles Puigdemont que Pedro Sánchez va fer en el debat de RTVE, perquè –ha dit– no parlava com a "candidat" ni com a "president de l'executiu", sinó com a "representant de l'Estat a l'exterior". "Era un plural majestàtic, volia informar de l'actitud de l'Estat", ha dit.
Sánchez va dir: " A vostès , senyor Casado , se'ls va escapolir Puigdemont, i jo em comprometo avui i aquí a portar-lo de tornada a Espanya i que rendeixi comptes davant la justícia espanyola". Preguntat per si això no podia ser entès com una promesa electoral, Cruz ha respost: "Si hi ha persones que s'agafen a les paraules «em comprometo». ¿Em comprometo a què? [...] Les persones que s'agafen a una paraula ho portaran molt malament perquè estaran tenint disgustos constantment", ha respost a una periodista.




Sánchez recorda que la Fiscalia depèn del govern espanyol per explicar com pensa extradir Puigdemont

En referència a l'extradició de Puigdemont, Cruz ha admès que Sánchez "no té cap eina per a una iniciativa com aquesta". Tot i això, ha afirmat que el govern espanyol en funcions pot "instar la Fiscalia a un determinat comportament", tal com també ho ha defensat en una entrevista aquest matí el president espanyol en funcions.
Malgrat matisar que és el ministeri públic qui ha d'"executar" i que no hi ha un " ordeno y mando", ha afirmat que hi ha una "cadena" entre l'executiu i el fiscal. "Una cadena que no impedeix l'autonomia de la Fiscalia", ha insistit. El candidat al Senat ha negat que la seva reflexió suposi una vulneració de poders, tot i que topa amb la versió que els socialistes mantenien durant el judici al Procés.
text:
Manuel Cruz (PSC): "Independence has been a factory of sympathizers of Vox"
Iceta considers that the extreme right would not have grown so much without the "tangle" of the Process

06 Nov 2019, 10:26

The Socialists offer themselves to the 10-N campaign as the only force capable of overcoming the extreme right and independentism, a discourse that despite persecuting an image moderation comes with the hardening of the discourse in Catalonia. In recent hours, in fact, the visible faces of the PSC in these elections have been responsible for the independentism of the growth of the extreme right, an accusation that until now had only been launched against PP and Cs for its agreements with Vox in the institutions.
At a press conference this Wednesday at the ACN, the president of the Senate and socialist candidate in the upper house on 10-N, Manuel Cruz, has admitted that both the people and the Orange party have "whitened" and given "political vitamins" to the extreme right, placing it within autonomous governments, but then he stated that "independence has been a factory of sympathizers of Vox."
Asked whether he was responsible for the independentism of the growth of the ultra-right, he wanted to point out that certain "behaviors" of independence can have this "undesired effect" by the movement, in the same way - he said - that there can be "violence "in response to the ruling of the Process when it is" obvious "that the" thickness "of independence is" peaceful ". "If not, we introduce taboos where we can not talk about anything," he insisted.
Cruz did not have to add that, at the height of the ultra-right, factors such as feminism or immigration have also been implicated. On immigration, he said that at the moment that Vox has made it a "central theme" of his speech, it is "obvious that there is a relationship," while on feminism he did not want to get wet.
Looking to bring back a thorny debate, Cruz has concluded, however, that the increase of Vox or the expected fall of Cs representation should "reflect" those forces that blocked the formation of a socialist government in July State "The scenario will not be exactly the same, I want to think that this will reflect all the forces," said the president of the Senate.




Sánchez stands as the candidate of Catalonia "forgotten" by the Government and assimilates independentism to the extreme right

On Tuesday, however, the PSC's first secretary, Miquel Iceta, already let out in an act in Sant Boi de Llobregat that Vox would not go so far in the polls without the "mess" of the Process. "Does anyone think that Vox would have risen so much without the mess that has been mounted with independence in Catalonia? Do we really believe it? No," he said.
In his view, "the right and the independentism are fed back." "They need themselves, they want," he said, arguing that the pro-independence activists are looking for "the worst Spain" to have arguments in favor of secession. Iceta's words pick up the glove that Peter Sánchez had released in the last few weeks comparing the extreme right with sovereignty because they think that there is only "one Catalonia" and "one Spain".
The "misunderstanding" with Sánchez: "He spoke as a representative of the State"
During the press conference on Wednesday, Cruz did not contradict Sánchez in this regard, but he has argued that there was a "misunderstanding" with the commitment to return Carles Puigdemont that Pedro Sánchez did in the debate of RTVE, because, he said, he did not speak as a "candidate" or as a "president of the executive", but as a "representative of the State abroad". "He was a majestic plural, he wanted to inform the attitude of the State," he said.
Sánchez said: "You, Mr. Casado, escaped Puigdemont, and I commit myself today and here to bring him back to Spain and pay tribute to the Spanish courts." Asked if this could not be understood as an electoral promise, Cruz responded: "If there are people who stick to the words" I commit myself. "Do I commit myself to what? [...] They take a word they will behave very badly because they will be constantly upset, "he replied to a journalist.




Sánchez recalls that the Public Prosecutor's Office depends on the Spanish government to explain how Puigdemont intends to extradite

With reference to the extradition of Puigdemont, Cruz has admitted that Sanchez "does not have any tools for an initiative like this one". However, he said that the Spanish government in functions can "urge the Public Prosecutor's Office to a certain behavior," as the Spanish President in charge of an interview this summer has also defended.
Despite clarifying that the public ministry has to "execute" and that there is no "order and command," he said that there is a "chain" between the executive and the prosecutor. "A chain that does not impede the autonomy of the Office of the Prosecutor", he insisted. The candidate for the Senate has denied that its reflection supposes a violation of powers, although it is in keeping with the version that the Socialists maintained during the trial of the Process.
